channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16144] Replication queue's lock will live forever if RS acquiring the lock has died prematurely
item.description:
In default, we will use multi operation when we claimQueues from ZK. But if we set hbase.zookeeper.useMulti=false, we will add a lock first, then copy nodes, finally clean old queue and the lock.

However, if the RS acquiring the lock crash before claimQueues done, the lock will always be there and other RS can never claim the queue.
item.summary: Replication queue's lock will live forever if RS acquiring the lock has died prematurely

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
We will set hbase.zookeeper.useMulti=false if we have many peers in a cluster, because a large zk batch operation may fail because the request size is too large.
I think we can add a periodical lock cleaner on master to delete locks if it is acquired by a dead region server.
I'll submit a patch later.
upload patch for master

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

+  public String getLockNode(String znode) {

Name the method getLockZNode().


+  public boolean checkLockExist(String znode) throws KeeperException {

checkLockExist -> checkLockExists


+      } catch (Exception e) {

+        LOG.warn("start replicationZKLockCleanerChore failed", e);

Should the above be at error level ?

Please add license to ReplicationZKLockCleanerChore

Please fix findbugs warnings.

+public class ReplicationZKLockCleanerChore extends ScheduledChore {

Add annotation for audience.


+          String[] array = rsServerNameZnode.split("/");

+          String znode = array[array.length - 1];

Should array.length be checked before accessing the array ?


+            if (s != null && System.currentTimeMillis() - s.getMtime() > TTL) {

Use EnvironmentEdge instead.


+        } catch (InterruptedException e) {

+          LOG.warn("zk operation interrupted", e);

Restore interrupt status.

Here array.length will always positive, so i think it is OK

The timestamp of mtime is set by zk, which is always System.currentTimeMillis(), if we use EnvironmentEdge, it may be wrong when it is not System.currentTimeMillis()?

Will fix other issues soon

if we use EnvironmentEdge, it may be wrong when it is not System.currentTimeMillis()?

Using EnvironmentEdgeManager is common practice.
It is used in classes such as HRegion.

I would suggest using EnvironmentEdgeManager in the above mentioned place.
Got it, thanks

This message was automatically generated.
Failed tests are unrelated and can pass locally

If the lock is ephemeral node in zk, then on RS crash, it will be deleted automatically. Any issues by making lock as ephemeral node ?
there are some discussion in HBASE-12241 and HBASE-2611 also.

If the RS get "session expired", RecoverableZooKeeper will try to reconnect instead of crash itself. If we use ephemeral node for lock, after reconnect there is no lock so more than one RS will copy the queue. In other words, if ephemeral node disappeared, we can not say the server must have died.
Thanks for clarification.

TTL in ReplicationZKLockCleanerChore will be changed in test cause, so it can not set to final.
Fix other issues

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #1174 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1174/)
HBASE-16144 Replication queue's lock will live forever if RS acquiring (tedyu: rev b5cdb38dc71a5b53a41879a945f9d596c07a0630)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/TestMultiSlaveReplication.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/cleaner/ReplicationZKLockCleanerChore.java
  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/ReplicationQueuesZKImpl.java
  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/ReplicationFactory.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMaster.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #1175 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1175/)
HBASE-16144 Revert - test failure in (tedyu: rev 20a99b4c06ecb77c29c3ff173052a00174b9af8c)

  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/ReplicationFactory.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/cleaner/ReplicationZKLockCleanerChore.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMaster.java
  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/TestMultiSlaveReplication.java
  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/replication/ReplicationQueuesZKImpl.java

In this test class, three cluster share the same zk cluster. In the end of testZKLockCleaner the cluster1 will be closed, so the shared zk is closed, too. If we run testZKLockCleaner first and then testMultiSlaveReplication, the closed zk will throw exception while creating utility2.startMiniCluster().

We can add a line "utility1.setZkCluster(miniZK);" in setUpBeforeClass to prevent closing zk when we close the cluster.

I'll upload a new patch soon, for master and other branches. Thanks.
patch for branch-1
Patch for branch-1 can also be applied to branch-1.2/1.3. Upload patch for 1.1

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: If zk based replication queue is used and useMulti is false, we will schedule a chore to clean up the orphan replication queue lock on zk.
